Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

Description.Text: The software constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component.

CommonConsequences.Note: The attacker can read sensitive information from the operating system
The attacker can modify system files and settings
The attacker can disable or crash the system

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

Description.Text: The software does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page that is served to other users.

CommonConsequences.Note: The attacker can steal session cookies or other credentials
The attacker can modify the web page content

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

Description.Text: The software constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended SQL command when it is sent to a downstream component.

CommonConsequences.Note: The attacker can read sensitive data from the database
The attacker can modify or delete database records
The attacker can drop tables or disable the database

Description.Text: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the software does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

CommonConsequences.Note: The attacker can access sensitive information
The attacker can modify user data

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')

Description.Text: The software constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

CommonConsequences.Note: The attacker can read sensitive data
The attacker can modify system state
The attacker can crash or disable the system
